image.altText: An older man in a hard hat and an orange Hi-Vis vest stands on a dock in front of the water.

props.synopsis: The project to deliver new Spirit of Tasmania vessels has led to another resignation at ferry operator TT-Line, this time the chief executive Bernard Dwyer, who was absent at a parliamentary inquiry on Monday.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania saga claims a third high-ranking official, as chief executive Bernard Dwyer resigns

image.altText: Ben Yole holds bridle of a horse.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's top harness racing trainer has had his trainer's licence reinstated despite an active investigation into allegations of race fixing, team driving and animal welfare concerns.

title.children: Top harness racing trainer free to compete again despite race fixing and animal welfare claims

image.altText: Two workers in Hi-Vis on a crane working on a powerline.

props.synopsis: More financial assistance has opened up for Tasmanians affected by the recent storm and flooding event, as residents continue assessing the damage.

title.children: 'Unprecedented scale of damage': Disaster relief grants of up to $10,000 announced by Tasmanian premier

image.altText: Smiling man in a suit, stands holding the budget paper for 2023

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Treasurer Michael Ferguson announces a record $5.1 billion infrastructure spend days out from this year's state budget, despite a warning from an independent review.

title.children: Tasmania's treasurer unveils record infrastructure spend, opposite to warning in independent review

image.altText: A man and a woman looking over paperwork with a calculator and computer

props.synopsis: In the United States, Americans can split or average out their income with their partner to reduce the tax they pay. Could this be adopted in Australia?

title.children: 'So blatant it's bordering on laughable': Family trust accounts minimise tax, so why can't couples have a joint tax return?

image.altText: A baby in hospital with burns.

props.synopsis: The nine-month-old was seriously burned in the attack at Stones Corner on August 27 and had to have surgery.

title.children: Baby boy's family 'devastated' man accused of coffee attack fled country a day before police confirmed his identity

image.altText: A man stands on the edge of a street in the foreground. Across the street are a number of large apartment buildings.

props.synopsis: Companies hired to manage millions of apartments across the country are exploiting owners in an industry with little regulation. Four Corners heard from more than 2,000 unit owners with horror stories of the industry's practices.

title.children: Secret deals and phantom fees: The 'unethical' tactics of Australian strata companies

image.altText: A close up image of a woman with short brown hair against a black background.

props.synopsis: Minerals Council chief executive Tania Constable has warned the industry is in a precarious state, blaming "reckless" federal government industrial relations reforms, state "royalty raids", "onerous" looming environmental rules, and high energy costs.

title.children: 'Conflict has been brought upon us': Mining industry slams Albanese over industrial relations reform

image.altText: A close-up of an Australian Army patch and an Australian flag patch on an ADF officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: The commissioners have called for a new permanent body to provide ongoing support to veterans.

title.children: Royal commission into veteran suicide hands down final report, calling for new support body

image.altText: Lachlan Murdoch

props.synopsis: In a polarised media world, it's never been more important to understand Lachlan Murdoch.

title.children: 'Do I need to sell my house?' The perils of writing about media mogul Lachlan Murdoch

image.altText: An older, bearded man with grey hair stands amid a crowd of journalist.

props.synopsis: Graeme McBride says he wants to be able to sleep on a dry pillow and lay in a comfortable position without a broken neck and heart.

title.children: Injured dad who lost wife, daughter in Hunter Valley bus crash tells court of ongoing trauma

image.altText: Woman looking up in a bathroom.

props.synopsis: Civil and administration tribunals are unable to adjudicate disputes involving landlords that live in different states to their rental properties, leaving tenants and landlords facing costly legal action to seek redress for issues with their rentals.

title.children: The legal loophole creating a headache for renters and landlords wanting action

image.altText: Real estate agent puts up a sold sticker after this Mosman apartment sold at auction.

props.synopsis: Politics and timing are inextricably linked — sometimes, the Zeitgeist suits your story, other times it doesn't. Kamala Harris and Bill Shorten both know that the hard way.

title.children: Australia could be ready to say goodbye to negative gearing

image.altText: Myer

props.synopsis: A major fashion retail consolidation is looming in Australia, as department store Myer considers buying up more than 700 of Premier Investment's apparel stores, including Just Jeans, Jay Jays, Portmans, Jacqui E and Dotti.

title.children: Australian fashion retail consolidation looming as Myer looks to buy Premier Investment's apparel brands

image.altText: Kamala Harris smiles and points at something above her in the distance, in front of a crowd.

props.synopsis: It has been a dream start to Kamala Harris's bid for the White House, and supporters are confident she'll beat Donald Trump in the popular vote — but the Electoral College is a different story.

title.children: Kamala Harris has a blue state dilemma that could cost her the election

image.altText: A Telstra payphone in a remote setting with trees and grass

props.synopsis: Taxpayers and telcos spend nearly $300 million a year to guarantee access to landlines and payphones, even though fewer and fewer people are using them.

title.children: The little-known 'dinosaur' policy that could be holding us back from better phone coverage

image.altText: Three firefighters stand on the footpath near a red fire truck, looking towards a brick house with police tape across it.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating whether three children under five were home alone when they were critically injured in a fire at Sydenham in Melbourne's north-west.

title.children: Three children critically injured in Melbourne fire had moved into home a week ago, police say

image.altText: Vanessa Amorosi wears a black jacket and pants and brown top and holds a black bag as she walks behind a white car.

props.synopsis: The estranged mother of Australian singer-songwriter Vanessa Amorosi has 60 days to leave the home she lost to her daughter in a bitter legal battle.

title.children: Vanessa Amorosi to sell disputed Melbourne home to cover $870k payment to her mother, court hears

image.altText: A close up of Nicki Hutley sitting in an office.

props.synopsis: It's not just older generations who think younger people are doing it tough. The list of people concerned about the impact of inflation on households includes economists, the boss of the Commonwealth Bank, Matt Comyn, and the Reserve Bank.

title.children: 'You can't blame the boomers': The generational divide behind Australia's cost-of-living split

image.altText: A man and woman hugging in front of a for sale sign at a house

props.synopsis: As the government returns to parliament to pick a new fight on housing, new figures reveal a third of first home buyers are using federal support for help to buy a home.

title.children: A third of first home buyers are leaning on government for help to put down a deposit

image.altText: A man looks at the camera with a blank expression.

props.synopsis: An alleged four-wheel-drive attack has been linked to an online video which police say depicts "an abhorrent act of animal cruelty".

title.children: WA farming couple sickened after calves allegedly mowed down in four-wheel-drive video

image.altText: A woman in a green dress smiles in front of some microphones during an event for a sports tournament

props.synopsis: The National Gender Equity in Sports Governance Policy aims to achieve 50-50 gender equity on all national and state sport boards by 2027, with consequences for non-compliance.

title.children: Government announces gender reforms for Australian sport

image.altText: A child with head tilted back receives oral drops with other children watching on

props.synopsis: UN officials say more than half of the 640,000 Gaza children who need to be immunised against polio have received the oral vaccine in the first two stages of the campaign.

title.children: Polio vaccination drive extended in southern Gaza Strip as parents rush to immunise children

image.altText: Nicola Spurrier at press conference

props.synopsis: South Australia has reported a six year high in whooping cough cases as the illness spikes across the country.

title.children: Whooping cough cases surging, with vulnerable groups urged to get vaccinated

image.altText: Josh Addo-Carr holds his hands on his hips

props.synopsis: Canterbury winger Josh Addo-Carr has allegedly returned a positive drug test on the eve of his side's return to the NRL finals.

title.children: Josh Addo-Carr allegedly returns positive cocaine test, Bulldogs say there is 'no truth' to claim

image.altText: A man in gold ceremonial chains and wearing medals and a suit and tie stands at a lectern with a microphone.

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea will bring in former New Zealand governor-general and senior diplomat Sir Jerry Mateparae to help resolve a deep impasse over Bougainville's political future.

title.children: PNG taps former NZ governor-general to mediate talks over Bougainville's independence

image.altText: Isaah Yeo is tackled by Sharks players

props.synopsis: Penrith and Melbourne are the firm favourites to play in this year's NRL grand final, but history shows the top two teams rarely face off in the decider.

title.children: 'It just doesn't work like that': Storm and Panthers on notice ahead of NRL finals

image.altText: A red four-wheel-drive is crushed by falling tree branches

props.synopsis: Officials warn that despite the typhoon's waning power, significant flooding is still possible in the aftermath of the typhoon.

title.children: At least 21 killed in Vietnam as threat from Typhoon Yagi continues

image.altText: People in a crowd holding signs

props.synopsis: Nurses and midwives are pushing ahead with significant stop work action tomorrow despite being told not to by the Industrial Relations Commission as they fight for a 15 per cent pay rise.

title.children: NSW nurses and midwives to press ahead with 12-hour strike tomorrow despite IRC order

image.altText: A young man in a cowboy hat near an outback stockyard.

props.synopsis: Sitting on the back of a bull and preparing to be launched into an arena, 20-year-old Leeuwin Gillett can feel the nerves and adrenaline building. In just a few seconds the world is going to look very different to him.

title.children: No practice, no worries, 'you just send it' say first-time rodeo riders

image.altText: olivia 2

props.synopsis: Damien Gibson will be handed a jail sentence later this year after pleading to culpable driving, causing the death of six-year-old Olivia Stevens.

title.children: Parents of 6yo killed in farm buggy crash tell driver he turned their 'dreams black'

image.altText: Kaden Groves and Jay Vine wave on a podium

props.synopsis: Australia has just had arguably its most successful grand tour performance in 14 years, winning two classifications jerseys and claiming second overall.

title.children: Historic results prove Australia is a cycling powerhouse

image.altText: Kelly Wilkinson stands alongside another woman, both are smiling.

props.synopsis: The court hears Bradley Bell is "not the man who actually caused the death" but was being tried for allegedly helping Brian Johnston kill his wife.

title.children: Colleague of man who murdered his ex-partner knew killer wanted to 'burn her' before driving him to her house, jury hears

image.altText: A photo showing a remote community mining town home

props.synopsis: Indigenous residents of the Manaburdurma Jabiru Town Camp are devastated the area's Mirarr traditional owners plan to demolish their homes to make way for a new road, as part of plans to redevelop the town into a Kakadu tourism centre.

title.children: Amid a national housing shortage, these town camp residents can't believe their community is to be demolished

image.altText: Lauren Parker and James Turner parade with the Australian flag at the Stade de France

props.synopsis: Australia's flag-bearers James Turner and Lauren Parker have paraded around the Stade de France and Paris bids au revoir.

title.children: 'Let's keep daring': Turner and Parker fly the flag as closing ceremony caps off Paris Paralympics
